Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Wednesday November 26), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for wednesday, november 26th. microsoft has announced its plans to integrate openai’s advanced language models into its suite of productivity tools, including microsoft word and excel. the move aims to supercharge productivity by automating routine tasks and providing detailed insights within documents and spreadsheets. with this integration, users can expect enhanced capabilities, such as creating drafts and summarizing data, allowing for a more intuitive and efficient workflow. 

meanwhile, amazon is ramping up its investment in renewable energy projects across europe. the company has announced new initiatives in germany, france, and italy, increasing the company's renewable capacity by 40% globally. this effort is part of amazon’s broader commitment to achieve net-zero carbon by 2040, and it highlights the tech giant’s push to power its massive data centers and operations with clean energy.

shares of zoom video communications have surged after the company reported a better-than-expected earnings for the third quarter. despite slowing growth post-pandemic, zoom managed to outperform analysts' predictions with a 10% rise in key enterprise client engagements. the company credits this success to an expansion of hybrid work solutions and its newly launched zoom events platform.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
"i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for wednesday, november 26th. microsoft has unveiled its strategy to integrate openai’s advanced language models into its suite of productivity tools, including word and excel. this initiative is designed to boost productivity by automating routine tasks and providing deeper insights within documents and spreadsheets. with this integration, users will benefit from enhanced capabilities like drafting content and summarizing data, leading to a more streamlined and efficient workflow.

in other news, amazon is significantly increasing its investment in renewable energy projects throughout europe. the company has announced new initiatives in germany, france, and italy, effectively boosting its global renewable capacity by 40%. these efforts align with amazon’s broader objective to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2040 and underline the tech giant’s commitment to powering its extensive data centers and operations with clean energy.

turning to the markets, shares of zoom video communications have surged following the announcement of stronger-than-expected earnings for the third quarter. despite experiencing slower growth after the pandemic, zoom exceeded analysts' expectations with a 10% rise in key enterprise client engagements. the company attributes this growth to the expansion of hybrid work solutions and the recent launch of its zoom events platform.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow."
Podcast Title: EP-418 Microsoft Integrates Openai into Office Suite 🖥️, Amazon's Renewable Energy Push in Europe 🌍, Zoom's Market Surge 📈
Podcast Description:
```html

join wall-e for today's tech briefing on wednesday, november 26th as we explore the latest developments in the tech world:

  • microsoft enhances productivity tools: the integration of openai’s advanced language models into microsoft word and excel aims to automate routine tasks, offering enhanced content drafting and data summarization capabilities to streamline workflows.
  • amazon's renewable energy expansion: amazon announces new projects in germany, france, and italy to boost renewable capacity by 40%, aligning with their goal to reach net-zero carbon emissions by 2040.
  • zoom video communications' market surge: following a stronger-than-expected earnings report for the third quarter, zoom sees a 10% rise in enterprise client engagements, driven by the growth of hybrid work solutions and their new zoom events platform.

stay tuned for more updates tomorrow!

```
